abstract.para: This guide describes how to attach a &productname; subscription to &rhel; 7 or CentOS Linux 7 using &suse;'s &smtool;.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: &productname; is a technology and support solution for mixed Linux environments. With a &productname; subscription, you can register and receive updates for &rhel;, CentOS Linux, and &sles;. An optional &ha; extension is also available.

To register &rhel; 7 or CentOS Linux 7, use &suse;'s &smtool; (⪪). ⪪ is a proxy system for the &scc;. The ⪪ server is registered with the &scc;, and other systems in the network are registered with the ⪪ server and receive packages from it directly. For more information, see the &smtool; Guide.
Registering &rhla; or CentOS Linux with ⪪ involves the following steps:

note.title: &productname; and &sles; with Expanded Support
note.para: &productname; now provides what used to be covered by the &sles; with Expanded Support subscription. Some components might still use the Expanded Support name during the transition period.

listitem.para: You have a &productname; subscription.
You have a &scc; account.
The systems you want to register have been updated to the latest version of &rhla; 7 or CentOS Linux 7.

&sles; (&slsa;) 12 is installed and running in the same network as the systems you want to register. You can use the &productname; subscription to register the &slsa; server. To install the latest version of &slsa; 12, see the

The &slsa; server has enough storage available for repository mirroring.

Downloaded packages are stored in /srv/www/htdocs/repo. The amount of storage required depends on the number of repositories that you mirror, and the number of products that you enable. We recommend 1.5 times the total size of all enabled repositories, or approximately 200 GB per release.

varlistentry.term: nginx.service is inactive after installing the rmt-server package

listitem.para: Continue the procedure to configure &rmt; in &yast;. This often resolves the issue. If that fails, Apache might be installed on your server, and must be disabled. Apache conflicts with NGINX because both web servers listen on port 80.

varlistentry.term: &productname; doesn't appear in rmt-cli products list after rmt-cli sync

listitem.para: Check your network. If the network is down, the sync command fails without showing an error.
If some packages could not be downloaded due to timeouts, rerun the rmt-cli mirror command until all packages are downloaded.

varlistentry.term: Setup script cannot access the &productname; repository

listitem.para: The repodata directory on the RMT server will not be available until all of the packages for that repository are downloaded. If some packages could not be downloaded to the RMT server due to timeouts during the first mirroring, rerun the rmt-cli mirror command until all packages are downloaded.

listitem.para: &productname; only supports the latest version of &rhla; or CentOS Linux. If your system is running the latest version and SUSEConnect still has package dependency issues, try the following workaround:
Edit the rmt-client-setup-res script to add --skip-broken to the following line:
